section.section: The power granted in paragraph (2) of this subsection is in addition to powers conferred on the Board by this subtitle and does not limit any power of the Board under this subtitle.
Subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the Board may authorize the Executive Director to take any of the actions described in paragraph (2) of this subsection.

If the Board authorizes the Executive Director to take any of the actions described in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Board shall prescribe limits within which the Executive Director may exercise discretion.

Except as otherwise provided by the Center, each issue of its bonds is a general obligation of the Center payable from any revenues or moneys of the Center that are available and not otherwise pledged.

The provisions of paragraph (1) of this subsection are subject to any agreements with:
holders of particular bonds pledging any particular revenues or moneys; and
any participating institution.

text.section: Subject to any provision for their registration, bonds are negotiable instruments for all purposes regardless of whether they are payable from a special fund.

section.section:
The bonds may be:
serial bonds;
term bonds; or
both in the discretion of the Center.
The bonds shall mature within a period not to exceed 50 years after their date.
The bonds shall be payable in United States currency.

text.section: The bonds may be sold by competitive or negotiated sale at a price determined by the Center.
Pending preparation of the definitive bonds, the Center may issue interim receipts or certificates that will be exchanged for definitive bonds.

section.section: A trust agreement authorizing bonds may contain provisions that are part of the contract with the bondholders.

text.section: The members of the Board and a person executing the bonds may not be held liable personally on the bonds.
